intro: Campanula farinulenta, commonly known as the farinulenta bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features upright stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a woolly texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Campanula farinulenta is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
